unnormalised: ## My Ears are Bleeding (with Joy!): A Humorous Look at Music Streaming
normalised: Okay, people, let us talk music streaming. Remember the good ol' days when you had to schlep all the way to Rhythm House in Colaba, Mumbai, hoping they hadn't sold out of the Anu Malik cassette you desperately needed? Those were the dark ages, my friends. Now, with a few taps on my phone, I can have the entire Bollywood soundtrack of *Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge* and some obscure Rajasthani folk songs, all competing for space in my eardrums. It's glorious chaos.

unnormalised: Okay, people, let’s talk music streaming. Remember the good ol' days when you had to schlep all the way to Rhythm House in Colaba, Mumbai, hoping they hadn’t sold out of the Anu Malik cassette you desperately needed? Those were the dark ages, my friends. Now, with a few taps on my phone, I can have the entire Bollywood soundtrack of *Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge* AND some obscure Rajasthani folk songs, all competing for space in my eardrums. It’s glorious chaos.
normalised: But let us be real, the algorithms are... quirky. I swear, Spotify thinks I am permanently stuck in nineteen ninety eight, blasting "Kuch Kuch Hota Hai" on repeat. I did listen to it once, Spotify! Once! Now, every day, I get a "Nostalgic Bollywood Bangers" playlist. I am starting to suspect my phone is plotting against my mental health.

unnormalised: But let’s be real, the algorithms are... quirky. I swear, Spotify thinks I’m permanently stuck in 1998, blasting "Kuch Kuch Hota Hai" on repeat. I did listen to it ONCE, Spotify! ONCE! Now, every day, I get a "Nostalgic Bollywood Bangers" playlist. I’m starting to suspect my phone is plotting against my mental health.
normalised: And don't even get me started on the ads. You are vibing to some chill Raag Yaman, feeling all Zen like you are back at your graduation from I I T Kanpur, and B A M! "Learn English with this revolutionary app!" I almost threw my phone across the room the other day. Rupees five hundred a month is *supposed* to shield me from this sonic assault!

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the ads. You’re vibing to some chill Raag Yaman, feeling all Zen like you're back at your graduation from IIT Kanpur, and BAM! "Learn English with this revolutionary app!" I almost threw my phone across the room the other day. Rupees 500 a month is *supposed* to shield me from this sonic assault!
normalised: The sheer volume of music is overwhelming, too. It is like trying to choose a ladoo from a wedding buffet. You *want* to try everything, but you know your stomach will revolt. So, you end up sticking to the classics (read: more Anu Malik).

unnormalised: The sheer volume of music is overwhelming, too. It's like trying to choose a ladoo from a wedding buffet. You *want* to try everything, but you know your stomach will revolt. So, you end up sticking to the classics (read: more Anu Malik).
normalised: But hey, even with the algorithmic oddities and the persistent ads, I am hooked. Where else can I find a remix of a Honey Singh song with a Carnatic flute solo? It is the Wild West of music, and I am here for the ride, ears bleeding with joy (and maybe a little bit of sonic fatigue). Plus, think of all the space I have saved by not needing to hoard physical C D s. My tiny Mumbai apartment thanks you, Spotify. Even if you *think* I need more Alka Yagnik in my life.

unnormalised: But hey, even with the algorithmic oddities and the persistent ads, I'm hooked. Where else can I find a remix of a Honey Singh song with a Carnatic flute solo? My tiny Mumbai apartment thanks you, Spotify. Even if you *think* I need more Alka Yagnik in my life.
